grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 醒覚【セイカク】awakening, waking up, opening one's eyes
半睡半醒【ハンスイハンセイ】half asleep and half awake
kun reading compounds: 覚ます【さます】to awaken, to arouse from sleep, to bring to one's senses, to disabuse (someone of), to sober up, to dampen, to throw a damper on, to spoil
覚める【さめる】to wake, to wake up, to become sober, to sober up, to regain consciousness (e.g. after anaesthesia), to come to one's senses, to be disillusioned
